translations.name: Berkeley Version
translations.description:
The Berkeley Version is a translation of the New Testament into English which was published by Zondervan in 1959 after parts of it were published in 1945. It is also referred to as the Modern Language Bible.
The translator’s goal was to create an up-to-date translation which reflects as directly as possible the meaning of the Hebrew, Aramaic, and Greek. It was treated as a revision of existing versions and not an original translation itself. Explanatory notes were revised as well as added. Topical headings were rephrased.
According to editor-in-chief Gerrit Verkuyl, the translation was motivated by \\\"The conviction that God wants His truth conveyed to His offspring in the language in which they think and live led me to produce the Berkeley Version of the New Testament. For I grew increasingly aware that the King James Version is only, in part, the language of our people today.\\\"
